page.title: 12CUCKFIELD PEOPLE & TRAVEL
page.content: For daily shopping people walk to the village stores. For weekly shopping they drive to Haywards Heath supermarkets (2 Miles). Cuckfield has a free car park (60 spaces) and street parking (waiting limit 1 hour). Bus services are infrequent. There are no Sunday or evening services. It costs 60p to go to Haywards Heath. Taxis cost Â£1.45p per mile (90p at night). Young children walk to school or are taken by car. Older children cycle more and use special bus services. Many residents are commuters, working in Crawley or London and travel by car or train. When people go on holiday, 50% stay in Britain, 50% go abroad. Most who stay in Britain travel by car. People travel by car, boat or plane to foreign destinations.
